contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox astronaut | name =Lev Stepanovich Dyomin | image =USSR stamp Soyuz-15 1974 10k.jpg | type =Cosmonaut | nationality = [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] | birth_date = {{Birth date|1926|1|11}} | birth_place = [[Moscow]], [[Russia]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1998|12|18|1926|1|11}} | death_place = [[Zvyozdny Gorodok]], [[Russia]] | occupation = [[Aviator|Pilot]] | rank = [[Colonel]], [[Soviet Air Force]]<ref name=SF-bio/> | selection = [[List of astronauts by selection#1963|Air Force Group 2]] | time = 2d 00h 12m<ref name=SF-bio/> | mission = [[Soyuz 15]] | insignia = |awards = {{Hero of the Soviet Union}} {{Order of Lenin}} |}} '''Lev Stepanovich Dyomin''' ({{Lang-ru|Лев Степанович Дёмин}}; January 11, 1926, in [[Moscow]] – December 18, 1998, in [[Zvyozdny Gorodok]]<ref name=SF-bio>{{cite web|url=http://www.spacefacts.de/bios/cosmonauts/english/dyomin_lev.htm|title=Cosmonaut Bio: Lev Dyomin|publisher=spacefacts.de}}</ref>) was a [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[cosmonaut]] who flew on the [[Soyuz 15]] [[spaceflight]] in 1974. This spaceflight was intended to dock with the [[space station]] [[Salyut 3]], but the docking failed. == Biography == Dyomin gained a doctoral degree in engineering from the Soviet Air Force Engineering Academy and the rank of Colonel in the Soviet Air Force.<ref name=SF-bio/> He only made a single spaceflight before resigning from the space programme in 1982 and taking up deep-sea research.<ref name=SF-bio/> He died of cancer in 1998.<ref name=SF-bio/> He was awarded: *[[Hero of the Soviet Union]] *[[Pilot-Cosmonaut of the USSR]] *[[Order of Lenin]] *[[Order of the Red Banner of Labour]] *[[Medal "For Combat Merit"]] *[[Medal "For the Development of Virgin Lands"]] *Order of the Banner of the People's Republic of Bulgaria ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Dyomin, Lev | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = January 11, 1926 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Moscow]], [[Russia]] | DATE OF DEATH = December 18, 1998 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Zvyozdny Gorodok]], [[Russia]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dyomin, Lev}} [[Category:1926 births]] [[Category:1998 deaths]] [[Category:People from Moscow]] [[Category:Soviet cosmonauts]] [[Category:Heroes of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Cancer deaths in Russia]] {{Russia-bio-stub}} {{Astronaut-stub}}
